title: The Stickit minister,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: cept the minister and the mistress of Arkland instinctively made on seeing a M'Lurg.

title: The Stickit minister,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Immediately after Jock and Rab had received a hunch of the Arkland loaf and their covenanted drink of milk, they went off to drive the cows to the loch road, so that they might at once begin to fill up their lean sides.

title: The Stickit minister,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: " There's sic a graun' big loaf come frae the Arkland!" By this time all her audience were on their feet.

title: The Stickit minister,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: They caught the Arkland  donkey grazing in the field beside the milldam,  and having made a parcel of the good black trousers and jacket, they tied them to the donkey and drove him homeward with blows and shout- ings.

title: The Stickit minister,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: of the Arkland off her guard.

title: The Stickit minister,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: The minister's text on the following Sabbath morning was an old one, but it was no old sermon that the* Arkland folk got that day.

title: The Stickit minister,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: A plain man was John Smith, of Arkland as plain and hodden gray as his name.

title: The Stickit minister,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Things had not gone well in Arkland that week.

title: The Stickit minister,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: IT is Friday, and the minister of Arkland was writing his sermon.
